descript.abstract: Data Type: Fish ; Fisheries Information Management System (FIMS) is a prototype computer system that links data sets routinely used by fisheries managers. This system is a relational data base structure. The purpose of this data set is to provide scientists and fisheries access to public information that will aid them in forming their fisheries plans. The relational database structure uses ORACLE programming. Output products include tables, statistical presentation and graphics. This data is portable to a GIS system to include ARC/INFO and MAP/INFO. Datasets included in FIM are NMFS weekly processor reports, NMFS survey data, NMFS observer data, NMFS FOCI data (oceanographic/climate), ADF&G CFEC fish ticket data, IPHC catch data, IPHC tagging studies, NMML sea lion data, regulatory data, sea surface temperature, bathymetry data, coastline data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
